column1: 2 ^ Misericordiās Dominī in aeternum cantābō; in generātiōnem et generātiōnem adnūntiābō vēritātem tuam in ōre meō

column3: and I will build up thy throne unto generation and generation.

column2: Domine
column3: etenim vēritātem tuam in ecclēsiā sānctōrum
column4: ^ The heavens shall confess thy wonders
column6: and thy truth in the church of the saints

column4: who is glorified in the assembly of the saints
column5: great and terrible above all them that are about him.

column3: Domine
column4: et vēritās tua in circumitū tuō. ^ O Lord God of hosts
column5: who is like to thee? Thou art mighty
column7: and thy truth is round about thee.

column1: 10 ^ Tū domināris potestātī maris; mōtum autem fluctuum ejus tū mītigās. ^ Thou rulest the power of the sea; thou also appeasest the motion of the waves.

column2: superbum; in bracchiō virtūtis tuae dispersistī inimīcōs tuōs. ^ Thou hast humbled the proud one
column3: as one that is slain; with the arm of thy strength thou hast scattered thy enemies.

column1: 12 ^ Tuī sunt caelī
column2: et tua est terra; orbem terrae et plēnitūdinem ejus tū fundāvistī. ^ Thine are the heavens
column3: and thine is the earth; the world and the fulness thereof thou hast founded.

column1: 13 ^ Aquilōnem et mare tū creāvistī; Tābor et Hermon in nōmine tuō exsultābunt. ^ The north and the sea thou hast created; Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.
14 ^ Tuum bracchium cum potentiā; firmētur manus tua
column2: et exaltētur dextera tua. ^ Thy arm is with might; let thy hand be strengthened
column3: and thy right hand exalted.

column1: 15 ^ Jūstitia et jūdicium praeparātiō sēdis tuae; misericordia et vēritās praecēdent faciem tuam. ^ Justice and judgment are the preparation of thy throne; mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
16 ^ Beātus populus
column2: quī scit jūbilātiōnem; Domine
column3: in lūmine vultūs tuī ambulābunt
column4: ^ Blessed is the people that knoweth jubilation; O Lord
column5: they shall walk in the light of thy countenance

column1: 17 ^ et in nōmine tuō exsultābunt tōtā diē
column2: et in jūstitiā tuā exaltābuntur
column3: ^ and in thy name they shall rejoice all the day
column4: and in thy justice they shall be exalted

column1: 18 ^ quoniam glōria virtūtis eōrum tū es
column2: et in benēplacitō tuō exaltābitur cornū nostrum
column3: ^ for thou art the glory of their strength
column4: and in thy good pleasure shall our horn be exalted

column1: 19 ^ quia Dominī est assumptiō nostra
column2: et sānctī Isrāēlis rēgis nostrī. ^ for our protection is of the Lord
column3: and of our king the holy one of Israel.

column1: 20 ^ Tunc locūtus es in vīsiōne sānctīs tuīs
column2: et dīxistī: Posuī adjūtōrium in potente
column3: et exaltāvī ēlēctum dē plēbe meā. ^ Then thou spokest in a vision to thy saints
column4: and saidst: I have laid help upon one that is mighty
column5: and have exalted one chosen out of my people.

column1: 21 ^ Invēnī Dāvid servum meum; oleō sānctō meō ūnxī eum. ^ I have found David my servant; with my holy oil I have anointed him.
22 ^ Manus enim mea auxiliābitur eī
column2: et bracchium meum confortābit eum. ^ For my hand shall help him
column3: and my arm shall strengthen him.

column1: 23 ^ Nihil prōficiet inimīcus in eō
column2: et fīlius inīquitātis nōn appōnet nocēre eī. ^ The enemy shall have no advantage over him
column3: nor the son of iniquity have power to hurt him.

column1: 24 ^ Et concīdam ā faciē ipsīus inimīcōs ejus
column2: et odientēs eum in fugam convertam. ^ And I will cut down his enemies before his face
column3: and them that hate him I will put to flight.

column1: 25 ^ Et vēritās mea et misericordia mea cum ipsō
column2: et in nōmine meō exaltābitur cornū ejus. ^ And my truth and my mercy shall be with him
column3: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

column1: 26 ^ Et pōnam in marī manum ejus
column2: et in flūminibus dexteram ejus. ^ And I will set his hand in the sea
column3: and his right hand in the rivers.

column1: 27 ^ Ipse invocābit mē: Pater meus es tū
column2: Deus meus
column3: et susceptor salūtis meae. ^ He shall cry out to me: Thou art my father
column5: and the support of my salvation.

column1: 28 ^ Et egō prīmōgenitum pōnam illum
column2: excelsum prae rēgibus terrae. ^ And I will make him my firstborn
column3: high above the kings of the earth.

column1: 29 ^ In aeternum servābō illī misericordiam meam
column2: et testāmentum meum fidēle ipsī. ^ I will keep my mercy for him for ever
column3: and my covenant faithful to him.

column1: 30 ^ Et pōnam in saeculum saeculī sēmen ejus
column2: et tronum ejus sīcut diēs caelī. ^ And I will make his seed to endure for evermore
column3: and his throne as the days of heaven.

column1: 31 ^ Sī autem dērelīquerint fīliī ejus lēgem meam
column2: et in jūdiciīs meīs nōn ambulāverint
column3: ^ If his children forsake my law
column4: and walk not in my judgments

column1: 32 ^ sī jūstitiās meās prōfānāverint
column2: et mandāta mea nōn custōdīverint
column3: ^ if they profane my justices

column1: 33 ^ vīsitābō in virgā inīquitātēs eōrum
column2: et in verberibus peccāta eōrum. ^ I will visit their iniquities with a rod
column3: and their sins with stripes.

column1: 34 ^ Misericordiam autem meam nōn dispergam ab eō
column2: neque nocēbō in vēritāte meā
column3: ^ But my mercy I will not take away from him
column4: nor will I suffer my truth to fail.

column1: 35 ^ neque prōfānābō testāmentum meum
column2: et quae prōcēdunt dē labiīs meīs nōn faciam irrita. ^ Neither will I profane my covenant
column3: and the words that proceed from my mouth I will not make void.

column1: 36 ^ Semel jūrāvī in sānctō meō
column2: sī Dāvidī mentiar; ^ Once have I sworn by my holiness
column3: if I will lie unto David;

column1: 37 ^ sēmen ejus in aeternum manēbit
column2: et tronus ejus sīcut sōl in conspectū meō
column3: ^ his seed shall endure for ever
column4: and his throne as the sun before me

column1: 38 ^ et sīcut lūna perfecta in aeternum
column2: et testis in caelō fidēlis. ^ and as the moon perfect for ever
column3: and a faithful witness in heaven.

column1: 39 ^ Tū vērō repulistī et dēspexistī; distulistī chrīstum tuum. ^ But thou hast rejected and despised; thou hast been angry with my anointed.
40 ^ Ēvertistī testāmentum servī tuī; prōfānāvistī in terrā sānctuārium ejus. ^ Thou hast overthrown the covenant of thy servant; thou hast profaned his sanctuary on the earth.
41 ^ Dēstrūxistī omnēs sēpēs ejus; posuistī firmāmentum ejus formīdinem. ^ Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast made his strength fear.
42 ^ Dīripuērunt eum omnēs transientēs viam; factus est opprobrium vīcīnīs suīs. ^ All that pass by the way have robbed him; he is become a reproach to his neighbours.
43 ^ Exaltāvistī dexteram dēprimentium eum; laetificāvistī omnēs inimīcōs ejus. ^ Thou hast set up the right hand of them that oppress him; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
44 ^ Āvertistī adjūtōrium gladiī ejus
column2: et nōn es auxiliātus eī in bellō. ^ Thou hast turned away the help of his sword
column3: and hast not assisted him in battle.

column1: 45 ^ Dēstrūxistī eum ab ēmundātiōne
column2: et sēdem ejus in terram collīsistī. ^ Thou hast made his purification to cease
column3: and thou hast cast his throne down to the ground.

column1: 46 ^ Minōrāvistī diēs temporis ejus; perfūdistī eum confūsiōne. ^ Thou hast shortened the days of his time; thou hast covered him with confusion.

column3: opprobriī servōrum tuōrum
